original: THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the sufficiency and receipt of which is hereby  acknowledged, the Parties agree that DD will promote MOXATAG to certain US physicians and others as  identified in this Agreement subject to the terms and conditions as set forth below:

This change could be beneficial if DD's internal strategy requires a more targeted approach or if they need flexibility in their promotional efforts. However, it is important to note that this modification should be carefully considered and discussed with all parties involved to ensure that the agreement remains balanced and fair.

original: Section 2 — Term This Agreement shall commence as of the Effective Date and shall continue in full force and effect  for an initial term of three (3) years from the Promotion Commencement Date, divided into three  one-year periods. Unless terminated in accordance with the provisions of Section 18, this  Agreement shall automatically renew for each subsequent one -year Section 3 — Obligations of DD 3.1 DD will promote MOXATAG to DD Target Segment Prescribers using its full suite of promotion  solutions where DD and MBRK deem appropriate, including but not limited to DD ’s a) eSampling Platform, b) eLearning / eDetailing, c) Educational Email, d) Direct -to-Physician  Bulletin Services, e) Physician Portal Promotions, f) Patient Portal Promotions, g) Direct Mail  Advertising, h) Coupon Promotions, i) Consumer Condition Content, j) Search Engine Marketing and k)  Mini Web Site Promotions where appropriate and with prior written approval from MBRK. MBRK shall  have final approval as to the promotion solutions utilized by DD in the promotion of MOXATAG and DD  will not deploy any promotion solution without such approval from MBRK. Such promotion solutions  are as listed in EXHIBIT 4. In the event that the Parties mutually agree on the provision of  additional services beyond those listed in EXHIBIT 4, such additional promotional solutions shall  be approved by MBRK and additional Appendices numbered sequentially (1, 2, 3, 4 etc.) setting forth  in detail the additional services shall be duly signed by authorized representatives of the Parties  and attached to EXHIBIT 4 and incorporated herein. The services contained in EXHIBIT 4 and any  related modifications thereto represent those services that are reasonably necessary to accomplish  the promotion of MOXATAG. No services shall be provided by DD, or paid for by MBRK, except as  agreed to in writing by the Parties.
ollama_generated:
Section 2 — Term
This Agreement will become effective on the Effective Date and shall remain binding unless terminated as specified in Section 18, for an initial period of three (3) years from the Promotion Commencement Date, which can be further divided into three one-year periods. However, either party may choose to discontinue this Agreement at the end of each one-year period without automatic renewal, providing notice of intent to terminate within 60 days prior to the expiration date.

Section 3 — Obligations of DD
3.1 DD has the discretionary authority to promote MOXATAG to DD Target Segment Prescribers using a selection of its promotion solutions, subject to the conditions and approvals specified below. DD may employ any combination of the following promotion solutions: a) eSampling Platform, b) eLearning / eDetailing, c) Educational Email, d) Direct -to-Physician  Bulletin Services, e) Physician Portal Promotions, f) Patient Portal Promotions, g) Direct Mail Advertising, h) Coupon Promotions, i) Consumer Condition Content, j) Search Engine Marketing and k) Mini Web Site Promotions. Prior written approval from MBRK is required for the use of these solutions, with MBRK retaining final approval over the promotion strategies utilized by DD in the promotion of MOXATAG.

However, DD reserves the right to employ additional promotional solutions beyond those listed above, subject to mutual agreement between the parties and subsequent approval from MBRK. Any such additional promotional solutions shall be detailed in duly signed Appendices numbered sequentially (1, 2, 3, 4 etc.) and attached to EXHIBIT 4, with the understanding that these new services are not obligatory and do not constitute part of the core agreement unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties. The services listed in EXHIBIT 4 and any modifications thereto represent the minimum services required for the promotion of MOXATAG. Any services provided by DD, or paid for by MBRK, must be explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties prior to implementation.

original: For example : if during the month of March 2010 (a) (A) above was 2,000 TRx and (B) above was  $36.50 then MBRK would be remit $36,500.00 to DD.
ollama_generated:
In the event that the number of transactions (A) mentioned in section 1.a during March 2010 totals 2,000 TRx and the price per transaction (B) indicated in section 1.b is $36.50, DD shall be entitled to receive a payment of $36,500.00 from MBRK.

The change in wording shifts the responsibility slightly by stating that if certain conditions are met, DD will receive the payment instead of MBRK remitting it. This does not significantly alter the meaning but clarifies the obligation and entitlement for clarity.

original: Accordingly, to facilitate the calculation and settlement of  monthly Promotion Fees for periods after September 2010, the Parties agree that the Gross Margin  Per Tablet used to settle the monthly Promotion Fees will be that as calculated using the previous  calendar quarter ’s Gross Margin Per Tablet data and current period ’s Actual DD Target Segment MOXATAG TRx . Such Promotion Fees for the three months in any calendar quarter will be subject  to a true -up process which will occur by the 15th of the second month of the following  quarter. By way of example, Promotion Fees for each of the months of April, May and June will be  settled using the Gross Margin Per Tablet amount that has been calculated for the quarter ended  March 31 and will be subject to a true -up process to occur by August 15 with any adjustment to such  Promotion Fees being settled between the parties within 15 days thereafter.
ollama_generated: For the effective determination and reconciliation of the monthly Bonus Payments commencing from October 2010, the Parties mutually consent that the Gross Margin Per Tablet utilized in computing the monthly Bonus Payments shall be based on the average of the past calendar quarter's Gross Margin Per Tablet figures and the current period's Actual DD Target Segment MOXATAG TRx. The Bonus Payments for any three-month duration within a given calendar quarter will undergo an adjustment process, which shall be carried out by the 15th of the third month subsequent to the end of that particular quarter. For instance, Bonus Payments for the months of July, August, and September will be settled using the average Gross Margin Per Tablet figure determined for the quarter ended June 30, followed by an adjustment process to be completed by November 15. Any discrepancies in the Bonus Payments shall be rectified between the parties within 15 days following the completion of the aforementioned adjustment process.

original: Attn: Accounts Payable MiddleBrook Pharmaceuticals, Inc.
ollama_generated:
Attn: Accounts Receivable, MiddleBrook Pharmaceuticals, Inc.

Upon receipt of the invoice for goods or services rendered, MiddleBrook Pharmaceuticals, Inc. agrees to make payment within a reasonable timeframe not exceeding forty-five (45) days from the date of the invoice, subject to any discounts offered and provided that the goods or services are in accordance with the terms of our agreement and are delivered as contracted.

In the event that the payment is late, MiddleBrook Pharmaceuticals, Inc. shall be responsible for paying interest on the outstanding amount at a rate of one percent (1%) per month. This clause supersedes any conflicting terms in previous correspondence or agreements regarding payment timing and interest accrual.

original: 6.2. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, MBRK shall have the sole right and  authority and in its sole discretion shall take any actions that it deems appropriate with respect  to MOXATAG as would normally be done in accordance with accepted business practices and federal and  state legal requirements to maintain the authorization and/or ability to market MOXATAG in the US,  including, without limitation, the following:
ollama_generated:
6.2. In the event of any inconsistency with other provisions within this Agreement, MBRK shall retain the discretion to determine actions pertaining to MOXATAG, which may deviate from typical business practices and legal requirements for marketing authorization in the US, as long as such actions are deemed reasonable by industry standards and comply with applicable federal and state laws. Any deviations from accepted business practices will be at the sole risk of MBRK. Such discretionary actions may include, but are not limited to:

1. Pursuing alternative marketing strategies for MOXATAG in the US, provided such strategies do not violate any applicable laws.
2. Engaging third-party consultants or agencies for assistance in maintaining the authorization and/or ability to market MOXATAG in the US.
3. Implementing necessary modifications to the marketing strategy of MOXATAG as deemed appropriate by MBRK, with the understanding that any such changes may involve additional risks.
4. Modifying or suspending the marketing of MOXATAG in the US, if MBRK determines it is necessary due to unforeseen circumstances or regulatory actions.

In all cases, MBRK will endeavor to exercise its discretionary authority in a manner that supports the overall objectives of this Agreement, but any risks associated with such discretionary decisions will be borne solely by MBRK.

original: 6.4. MBRK shall be responsible for the costs of obtaining, tracking, processing, formatting and  reporting Prescriber 6.5. The Cost of Samples Amount and the Cost of Coupon Redemption Amount shall be paid by MBRK.
modified:
6.4. For the costs associated with obtaining, tracking, processing, formatting, and reporting Prescriptions, the responsibility lies with the Prescriber, unless otherwise specified in writing. The Cost of Samples Amount and the Cost of Coupon Redemption Amount may be reimbursed by MBRK, subject to the terms and conditions outlined in this agreement.

This revision shifts some of the responsibilities from MBRK to the Prescriber, making it clear that MBRK only pays the costs if specified in writing, and only under the agreed-upon terms and conditions.

original: 8.2. Each Party represents and warrants that it shall comply in all material respects with any and  all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations and industry guidances and standards  applicable to the conduct of business and the execution of any and all marketing and promotional  services or activities pursuant to this Agreement, including but not limited to: the federal  anti-kickback statute, 42 U.S.C. § 1320a -7b(b); federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act and relevant  regulations; FDA promotional guidelines; FDA ’s Guidance on Industry -Supported Scientific and  Educational Activities (1997); US Department of Health and Human Services OIG Compliance Program  Guidance for Pharmaceutical Manufacturers (2003); the Pharmaceutical  Research and Manufacturers of America ( “PhRMA”) Code on Interactions With Healthcare Professionals;  and ethics opinions of the American Medical Association ( “AMA”).  (k) reporting significant losses and thefts of MOXATAG to the appropriate state and federal  regulatory authorities, as required. In such a situation, DD will make available to MBRK, upon  request, all of DD ’s pertinent records on MOXATAG. Any and all reasonable and documented  costs and expenses incurred by DD in the conduct of such activities shall be reimbursed by  MBRK, except to the extent such reporting obligations were the direct result of the negligence  or failure of DD to comply with its obligations under this Agreement; and (l) negotiating any and all agreements with managed care organizations, payers, wholesalers,  group purchasing organizations, and the like, regarding MOXATAG.
ollama_generated:
8.2. Each Party acknowledges and undertakes to act in good faith by ensuring compliance, to the best of their ability, with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, regulations, and industry guidelines pertaining to business conduct and marketing/promotional activities under this Agreement. This includes but is not limited to: the federal anti-kickback statute (42 U.S.C. § 1320a -7b(b)), the federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act and related regulations, FDA promotional guidelines, FDA's Guidance on Industry-Supported Scientific and Educational Activities (1997), US Department of Health and Human Services OIG Compliance Program Guidance for Pharmaceutical Manufacturers (2003), the Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America (PhRMA) Code on Interactions With Healthcare Professionals, and ethics opinions of the American Medical Association (AMA).

Regarding reporting significant losses and thefts of MOXATAG, each Party shall exercise their discretion. If either Party chooses to report such incidents, they retain the right to request relevant records from the other party. Any costs and expenses incurred by the requesting party in this process will be borne entirely by them, unless the reporting obligation was a direct result of the other party's negligence or failure to comply with their obligations under this Agreement.

Lastly, each Party shall have the autonomy to negotiate any agreements concerning MOXATAG with managed care organizations, payers, wholesalers, group purchasing organizations, and similar entities; however, they are not obligated to do so unless mutually agreed upon by both Parties.

original: 8.3. Each Party represents and warrants that it shall comply with any and all applicable federal,  state, and local laws and regulations related to the request and receipt of MOXATAG samples,  including, but not limited to, the Prescription Drug Marketing Act of 1987 ( “PDMA”) of 1987, as  amended, and the regulations promulgated thereunder.
ollama_generated: 8.3. While each Party is expected to adhere to applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding the acquisition and handling of MOXATAG samples, it is acknowledged that compliance with specific statutes or regulations, such as the Prescription Drug Marketing Act of 1987 ( "PDMA" ) of 1987, as amended, and the regulations thereunder, shall be undertaken at each Party's discretion, recognizing potential risks associated with non-compliance.

original: (f) Termination for Change of Control and Fees — If MBRK terminates this Agreement in the first  year of the Agreement for any reason, then MBRK will pay DD a) an Early Termination Fee plus b) the  End of Agreement Fee. If MBRK terminates the Agreement in years 2 or 3 prior to the period 60 days  before the anniversary date, then MBRK will pay DD only the Early Termination Fee. If the Agreement  is terminated in years 2 or 3 by MBRK providing notice to DD within 60 days of the then current  anniversary date of its intent not to renew, then MBRK will pay DD the End of Agreement Fee but no  Early Termination Fee.
modified: (f) Termination and Fees — If DD terminates this Agreement within the first year for any reason, then MBRK shall have no obligation to pay any fees to DD. If DD terminates the Agreement in years 2 or 3 prior to the period 60 days before the anniversary date, then MBRK shall only be liable to pay DD the Early Termination Fee. However, if MBRK provides notice to DD within 60 days of the then current anniversary date of its intent not to renew, and DD chooses to terminate the Agreement, then MBRK will pay DD the End of Agreement Fee but no Early Termination Fee.

original: Section 19  — Force Majeure Each party shall be excused from liability for the failure or delay in performance of any  obligation under this Agreement by reason of any extraordinary, unexpected and/or unavoidable  event, such as acts of God, fire, flood, explosion, earthquake, or other natural forces, war, civil  unrest,  accident, destruction or other casualty, any lack or failure of transportation facilities, any lack  or failure of supply of raw materials, any strike or labor disturbance, or any other event similar  to those enumerated above.
ollama_generated:
Section 19 — Extraordinary Events Release from Obligation
Each party shall be released from the responsibility for any interruption or tardiness in fulfilling their obligations under this Agreement due to extraordinary, unforeseen, and unavoidable occurrences. Such events may include acts of God, fire, flood, explosion, earthquake, or other natural disasters; acts of war, civil disturbance, or political upheaval; accidents, damage, or casualties; any interruption in transportation facilities; supply shortages of essential materials; labor strikes or disruptions; or similar extraordinary events.

The key changes made to the original clause include shifting the responsibility from "excused" (meaning not held accountable) to "released from the responsibility" (meaning no longer obligated), and changing "shall be excused from liability for the failure or delay in performance" to "shall be released from the responsibility for any interruption or tardiness in fulfilling their obligations." This change weakens the obligation slightly by removing the requirement of compensation, as "liability" is replaced with a broader term that encompasses both obligations and financial responsibilities.

original: 7 Village Circle — Suite 100 Westlake, TX 76206 Telephone: 817 -837-1215 Facsimile: 817 -582-0400 Section 21 — Disputes/Arbitration 21.1. In the event of any controversy or claim arising from or relating to any provision of this  Agreement, or any term or condition hereof, or the performance by a party of its obligations  hereunder, or its construction or its actual or alleged breach, the Parties will try to settle  their differences amicably between themselves in negotiations between the Parties ’ respective  Presidents or their executive level designees. If the dispute has not been resolved to the mutual  satisfaction of the Parties within sixty (60) days after delivery of written notice of such  dispute, either party may request binding arbitration.
ollama_generated:
21. Conflict Resolution/Mediation
21.1. In the event that any disagreement or dispute emerges from, or pertains to, any aspect of this Agreement, including its provisions, conditions, fulfillment, interpretation, or alleged violation, the Parties will first endeavor to resolve their discrepancies through amicable negotiations between the Presidents or their designated executive representatives. If a resolution has not been reached to both parties' satisfaction within sixty (60) days of receiving written notice of the dispute, either party shall have the right to initiate binding mediation.

In this revised clause, the process starts with negotiation between the presidents or their designated executives. If a resolution is not achieved, either party can request binding mediation instead of arbitration as in the original clause. This slight change implies a more cooperative and conciliatory approach to resolving disputes before resorting to more formal methods such as arbitration or litigation.

original: Section 22 — Assignment/Change of Control This Agreement shall bind the Parties hereto and their successors and assigns, provided that  neither party shall have the right to assign this Agreement or any part thereof to a third party  without the prior written consent of the other party, however such consent will not be unreasonably  withheld.
modified:
Section 22 — Assignment/Change of Control: This Agreement shall remain binding upon the Parties and their respective assigns, except that either Party may transfer or assign this Agreement or any portion hereof to a third party at their discretion. However, such assignment shall be subject to the condition that the receiving party provides written consent, which will not be arbitrarily withheld by the non-assigning Party.

In this version, the change is that the initial party now has the right to assign the Agreement to a third party at their discretion (without needing prior written consent), while the other party can still withhold consent, but not arbitrarily.

   Name: Jay Grobowsky     Name: John Thievon

   Date:   February 3, 2010     Date:   February 3, 2010
   EXHIBIT 1 TO AGREEMENT BETWEEN DOCTORDIRECTORY.COM, INC. AND MBRK PHARMACEUTICALS, INC.

Rewritten clause with subtle changes:
In the event of a dispute arising between the parties under this Agreement, it shall be the exclusive responsibility of each party to first engage in good-faith negotiations to resolve the matter amicably. If these negotiations fail, and only if failure of negotiations is certified by an independent mediator, either party may then commence arbitration proceedings. This clause is intended to minimize the potential for costly litigation and foster a cooperative business relationship between the parties.

Original meaning: The parties will attempt to resolve disputes through good-faith negotiations before resorting to arbitration.

Rewritten meaning: The parties must first engage in good-faith negotiations to resolve disputes, but only if these negotiations fail (as certified by an independent mediator) may one party then commence arbitration proceedings. This change emphasizes the necessity of negotiation and shifts the responsibility for initiating arbitration to the failure of negotiations.

original: DATED FEBRUARY 3, 2010 DD TARGET SEGMENT PRESCRIBERS The Parties agree that the list of DD Target Segment Prescribers (hereinafter, “DD Target List ”) will be provided to MBRK by DD. MBRK shall have final approval of the DD Target List. MBRK receipt  and approval of the DD Target List shall be documented in writing by the Parties. DD Target  Segment Prescribers shall consist of only those licensed prescribers whose clinical practice is  consistent with MOXATAG ’s approved labeling, uses, and indication.
ollama_generated:
DATED FEBRUARY 3, 2010

Between the Parties (hereinafter "Parties"), MBRK has the right to request a list of potential DD Target Segment Prescribers (hereinafter, "DD Target List"). It is understood that DD will provide this list to MBRK, but MBRK reserves the discretion to modify or expand the list.

Any modifications made by MBRK shall be communicated to DD in writing for documentation purposes. The final DD Target List, as approved by MBRK, will be considered effective and binding upon the Parties.

It is important to note that while the DD Target Segment Prescribers shall primarily consist of licensed prescribers, MBRK shall not be responsible for validating or ensuring the consistency of these prescribers' clinical practice with MOXATAG’s approved labeling, uses, and indication. This responsibility lies solely with the respective prescribers and relevant regulatory authorities.

In case of any dispute arising from this provision, the parties shall endeavor to reach a mutual understanding through discussions, with any unresolved matters subject to resolution via mediation or arbitration as mutually agreed upon by the Parties.
